abstract: Trial begins in murder case against Pedro Hernandez, charged with 1979 killing of 6-year-old Etan Patz, boy who vanished near his SoHo apartment building; while prosecution asserts that Hernandez is cunning predator, defense aims to prove that his confession in baffling 35-year-old case is unreliable because of his diminished mental capability and personality disorder.
lead_paragraph: Pedro Hernandez, who is accused of the murder, confessed that he had killed a child to a church group and others in the early 1980s, a prosecutor said during opening statements on Friday.
snippet: Pedro Hernandez, who is accused of the murder, confessed that he had killed a child to a church group and others in the early 1980s, a prosecutor said during opening statements on Friday.

headline.main: Etan Patz Trial Starts, 35 Years After Boy Disappeared on SoHo Street
headline.print_headline: Murder Trial Starts, 35 Years After Boy Disappeared on SoHo Street
